summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering the evening of August 9, 2019, through the morning of August 10, 2019. It details routine prison operations and, most significantly, the medical emergency and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 who was found unresponsive in cell Z06-220 on the morning of August 10, 2019, leading to a medical emergency, CPR, and transport to a local hospital.

persons.context: Inmate #86824-054 who was placed in a dry cell under staff watch and later transferred to special housing (dry cell) on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at approximately 6:33 AM. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and EMS arrived. He was transported to a local hospital with CPR still in progress.

events.title: Inmate Fernandez Placed in Dry Cell
events.description: Inmate Fernandez (#86824-054) was placed in a dry cell under staff watch and later formally transferred to special housing (dry cell) at 3:58 PM.

events.title: Inmate Mutimura Admitted
events.description: Inmate Mutimura (#76329-054) was logged as entering the institution during the 3:45 PM lockdown count.

events.title: Inmate Carreon-Macias Released on Bail
events.description: Inmate Carreon-Macias (#82858-198) was released on bail bond at 3:59 PM.

events.title: Inmates Williams and Felix Transferred to Psych Observation
events.description: Inmates Williams (#78640-054) and Felix (#85775-054) were transferred to special housing (psych observation) at 7:24 PM.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (Inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
The log records the sequence of events: medical emergency announced, CPR in progress, 911 notified, EMS arrival, and transport to a local hospital with CPR ongoing.
The document shows routine prison operations were ongoing prior to the incident, including inmate counts, equipment checks, and transfers of other inmates.
Several other inmates are mentioned in the logs for administrative reasons (dry cell, psych observation, bail release, new admission), providing context on the prison's population that day.
The logs indicate some system malfunctions, including an inoperable fire alarm/pump system and a malfunctioning public address system, which prevented standard PREA announcements.
